person.persName: Joseph M. Bigger (Ballard County, Kentucky, attorney and judge)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, attorney and judge. Simpson County, Kentucky, native. Married to Francis "Fannie" N. Stephens Bigger in 1846. Educated in the common schools of Barren County, Kentucky, and Warren County, Kentucky. Studied law under Judge E. I. Bullock in Hickman, Kentucky. Admitted to the bar in 1847. Attorney in Ballard County from 1847 to 1853. Member of the Whig Party. Relocated to Paducah, Kentucky in 1853. Attorney in Paducah from 1853 to 1858. Member of the Democratic Party. Judge of the Equity and Criminal court for the First Judicial District of Kentucky, in Paducah, from 1858 to 1861, when the court ceased. Owned four enslaved persons in 1850 and two in 1860.
